title: CDC data shows Covid-19 cases rising in majority of US states
Michelle Obama 'not keen' to campaign for Biden. This is why
content: ​Former first lay Michelle Obama is not very keen to publicly campaign for President Joe Biden's re-election because Kathleen Buhle, Hunter Biden's former wife, is Michelle's friend, reports claimed. Axios reported that Michelle was not happy how the Bidens treated her friend. Hunter Biden who is under fire for the gun case, split from Kathleen in 2017. In his memoir, he documented his ex-wife's friendship with Michelle -- they used to work out together at the gym and often had evening cocktails at the White House -- at both formal and informal events.
summary: ​Former first lay Michelle Obama is not very keen to publicly campaign for President Joe Biden's re-election because Kathleen Buhle, Hunter Biden's former wife, is Michelle's friend, reports claimed. Axios reported that Michelle was not happy how the Bidens treated her friend. Hunter Biden who is under fire for the gun case, split from Kathleen in 2017. In his memoir, he documented his ex-wife's friendship with Michelle -- they used to work out together at the gym and often had evening cocktails at the White House -- at both formal and informal events.

title: Seattle struggles with increasing drug use and prostitution
content: Seattle is grappling with a severe crisis as parts of the city have turned into what some residents are calling a "zombieland" due to rampant drug use and prostitution. The situation has significantly deteriorated, raising concerns among locals and officials alike.
summary: Seattle is grappling with a severe crisis as parts of the city have turned into what some residents are calling a "zombieland" due to rampant drug use and prostitution. The situation has significantly deteriorated, raising concerns among locals and officials alike.

title: China is hiring Western aviators for Taiwan conflict
content: The Chinese Communist Party (CCP) is reportedly hiring Western military aviators to enhance its combat readiness in anticipation of a potential conflict with Taiwan. This revelation comes from a Taiwanese military expert who has raised alarms about the implications of such hires for regional security.
summary: The Chinese Communist Party (CCP) is reportedly hiring Western military aviators to enhance its combat readiness in anticipation of a potential conflict with Taiwan. This revelation comes from a Taiwanese military expert who has raised alarms about the implications of such hires for regional security.

Is Hawk Tuah girl set for Hollywood debut? Here's what we know so far
content: A lot has happened after Hawk Tuah took over the Internet on June 11. A Tennessee-based company, the official platform for Hawk Tuah merchandise, has sold at least $65,000 worth of merchandise. Hailey Welch, the Hawk Tuah girl is in touch with lawyers to get a trademark on her phrase. Rumors of Welch debuting in Hollywood are also doing the rounds. Meanwhile, Brandon Gaudin said 'Hawk Tuah' during match commentary.

A Tennessee-based company, the official platform for Hawk Tuah merchandise, has sold at least $65,000 worth of merchandise. Meanwhile,  Brandon Gaudin said 'Hawk Tuah' during match commentary.

title: Prince Harry deliberately destroyed phone hacking evidence: Report
content: ​Prince Harry was awarded 140,600 pounds last year after the London high court ruled that he had been the victim of "modest" phone hacking and other unlawful information gathering by journalists of British newspapers. Now it has been claimed that the Duke of Sussex deliberately destroyed potential evidence relating to the high court hacking claim, The Telegraph reported. The new claims surfaced ahead of a hearing on the case on Thursday.
summary: ​Prince Harry was awarded 140,600 pounds last year after the London high court ruled that he had been the victim of "modest" phone hacking and other unlawful information gathering by journalists of British newspapers. Now it has been claimed that the Duke of Sussex deliberately destroyed potential evidence relating to the high court hacking claim, The Telegraph reported. The new claims surfaced ahead of a hearing on the case on Thursday.

title: Ashley's 'LGBCT...' moment viral ahead of tonight's massive Biden vs Trump
content: Ahead of tonight's first presidential face-off between Joe Biden and Donald Trump, the video of Biden's daughter Ashley Biden finding it hard to say 'LGBTQ' went viral with social media users claiming that the apple doesn't fall far from the tree and that the family needs help -- given the recent gaffe videos of President Joe Biden which the White House dismissed. In the viral video, Ashley was attempting to say 'LGBTQ' but fumbled for a moment as she said 'LGBCT..' LGBTQ is widely known acronym for lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender and queer.
summary: Ahead of tonight's first presidential face-off between Joe Biden and Donald Trump, the video of Biden's daughter Ashley Biden finding it hard to say 'LGBTQ' went viral with social media users claiming that the apple doesn't fall far from the tree and that the family needs help -- given the recent gaffe videos of President Joe Biden which the White House dismissed. In the viral video, Ashley was attempting to say 'LGBTQ' but fumbled for a moment as she said 'LGBCT..' LGBTQ is widely known acronym for lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender and queer.

title: Scientists warn of 'most dangerous' mpox strain causing miscarriages, child deaths
content: Researchers warn of a new, deadly strain of mpox in the Democratic Republic of Congo, causing miscarriages and child fatalities. Known as clade Ib, it spreads via sexual and non-sexual contact, posing a significant health threat. Originating in Kamituga, South Kivu, it has led to over 1,000 cases with high mortality rates. Concerns mount over its potential spread to neighbouring countries, emphasizing the need for preparedness and vaccine efficacy evaluation amid fears of a wider epidemic.
summary: Researchers warn of a new, deadly strain of mpox in the Democratic Republic of Congo, causing miscarriages and child fatalities. Known as clade Ib, it spreads via sexual and non-sexual contact, posing a significant health threat. Originating in Kamituga, South Kivu, it has led to over 1,000 cases with high mortality rates. Concerns mount over its potential spread to neighbouring countries, emphasizing the need for preparedness and vaccine efficacy evaluation amid fears of a wider epidemic.

title: Russia weighs diplomatic downgrade with west amid Ukraine conflict
Indian-origin activist among three women charged for staging protest in Palestinian's support in Singapore
content: Three women, including an Indian-origin activist, faced charges for organizing a procession supporting the Palestinian cause without a permit in a prohibited area. They carried umbrellas symbolizing solidarity and delivered letters to the Prime Minister's office.
summary: Three women, including an Indian-origin activist, faced charges for organizing a procession supporting the Palestinian cause without a permit in a prohibited area. They carried umbrellas symbolizing solidarity and delivered letters to the Prime Minister's office.

title: Texas woman with her 16-month-old son denied boarding after misgendering flight attendant
content: Jenna Longoria, a women's health expert from Texas, was refused boarding on a United Airlines flight from San Francisco after unintentionally misgendering a flight attendant twice while boarding. Despite seeking assistance for her crying son, Longoria and her family were barred from the flight, allegedly for excess carry-on items—a claim she disputes. United Airlines cited concerns over comments made, including those about transgender issues, prompting backlash and leaving Longoria seeking clarification and resolution following the incident.
summary: Jenna Longoria, a women's health expert from Texas, was refused boarding on a United Airlines flight from San Francisco after unintentionally misgendering a flight attendant twice while boarding. Despite seeking assistance for her crying son, Longoria and her family were barred from the flight, allegedly for excess carry-on items—a claim she disputes. United Airlines cited concerns over comments made, including those about transgender issues, prompting backlash and leaving Longoria seeking clarification and resolution following the incident.

title: Watch: Bolivian general gets arrested on live TV after failed coup attempt
content: On Wednesday, Bolivia experienced a swift and dramatic coup attempt led by General Juan José Zúñiga, who claimed to be acting to "restore democracy." Armored vehicles rammed the government palace doors, prompting President Luis Arce to call it a coup attempt. Within hours, Arce named a new army commander who ordered the troops to stand down. The rebellion ended after three hours, with soldiers and military vehicles retreating. Hundreds of Arce's supporters celebrated outside the palace.
summary: On Wednesday, Bolivia experienced a swift and dramatic coup attempt led by General Juan José Zúñiga, who claimed to be acting to "restore democracy." Armored vehicles rammed the government palace doors, prompting President Luis Arce to call it a coup attempt. Within hours, Arce named a new army commander who ordered the troops to stand down. The rebellion ended after three hours, with soldiers and military vehicles retreating. Hundreds of Arce's supporters celebrated outside the palace.

title: 'Absolutely f*****g hates him': Will Prince William forgive his brother Prince Harry ? What experts say
content: Prince William's strong stance against Prince Harry's actions and firm control over the royal family indicate a slim chance of reconciliation between the brothers in the near future. Michael Cole has claimed that Prince William, is "not going to forgive" Prince Harry because there is "too much bad blood," between the royal brothers.
summary: Prince William's strong stance against Prince Harry's actions and firm control over the royal family indicate a slim chance of reconciliation between the brothers in the near future. title: Attorney who beat Trump twice in court starts boutique firm
content: Roberta Kaplan, the prominent trial lawyer known for representing New York writer E. Jean Carroll in her lawsuits against Donald Trump, is leaving Kaplan Hecker & Fink, the firm she founded seven years ago. Kaplan announced on Wednesday that she is starting a new boutique firm, Kaplan Martin, with partner Tim Martin and a trio of close friends. The new firm will specialize in civil litigation, internal corporate investigations, and strategic advisory. Kaplan cited the unexpected growth of Kaplan Hecker & Fink and her desire to shift away from white-collar matters as reasons for the change.
summary: Roberta Kaplan, the prominent trial lawyer known for representing New York writer E. Jean Carroll in her lawsuits against Donald Trump, is leaving Kaplan Hecker & Fink, the firm she founded seven years ago. Kaplan announced on Wednesday that she is starting a new boutique firm, Kaplan Martin, with partner Tim Martin and a trio of close friends. The new firm will specialize in civil litigation, internal corporate investigations, and strategic advisory. Kaplan cited the unexpected growth of Kaplan Hecker & Fink and her desire to shift away from white-collar matters as reasons for the change.

title: Nepal Rains: Landslides, floods, and lightning kill 14
content: Nepal faces a grim toll as recent monsoon activities claim lives across various regions. Landslides, floods, and lightning have led to multiple fatalities, highlighting the nation's susceptibility to natural disasters. With La Nina conditions predicted to influence rainfall patterns, proactive measures are essential to mitigate the impact on vulnerable communities.
summary: Nepal faces a grim toll as recent monsoon activities claim lives across various regions. Landslides, floods, and lightning have led to multiple fatalities, highlighting the nation's susceptibility to natural disasters. With La Nina conditions predicted to influence rainfall patterns, proactive measures are essential to mitigate the impact on vulnerable communities.

title: Heroic act turns fatal: New Jersey man killed by lightning while warning others of storm
content: Patrick Dispoto, 59, was struck by lightning and killed while warning beachgoers of an approaching storm at Seaside Park Beach, New Jersey. Despite his girlfriend Ruth Fussell's pleas to stay safe, Dispoto returned to the beach to alert children. Emergency responders' efforts to revive him were unsuccessful. Following the incident, Seaside Park installed a $50,000 Strike Guard Lightning Detection System. Fussell remembered Dispoto as a selfless person who always helped others, calling his final act "ultimate heroism."
summary: Patrick Dispoto, 59, was struck by lightning and killed while warning beachgoers of an approaching storm at Seaside Park Beach, New Jersey. Despite his girlfriend Ruth Fussell's pleas to stay safe, Dispoto returned to the beach to alert children. Emergency responders' efforts to revive him were unsuccessful. Following the incident, Seaside Park installed a $50,000 Strike Guard Lightning Detection System. Fussell remembered Dispoto as a selfless person who always helped others, calling his final act "ultimate heroism."

title: 'Fired after complaining about poor repair work on some Boeing 787 jets', claims whistleblower
content: Richard Cuevas raised safety concerns about Boeing's 787 Dreamliner construction, leading to investigations by various authorities. He has filed complaints with two US agencies, claiming he faced retaliation after raising concerns about potential manufacturing issues on the Boeing 787 Dreamliner. The FAA is actively looking into the multiple safety reports received this year.
summary: Richard Cuevas raised safety concerns about Boeing's 787 Dreamliner construction, leading to investigations by various authorities. He has filed complaints with two US agencies, claiming he faced retaliation after raising concerns about potential manufacturing issues on the Boeing 787 Dreamliner. The FAA is actively looking into the multiple safety reports received this year.

title: 'You can’t suppress it forever': Prince Harry opens up about losing mother Diana at 12
content: ​​Having lost his mother, Diana, Princess of Wales, at the age of 12, Prince Harry offered his perspective on coping with loss. The video, shot in May and released ahead of Armed Forces Day, aims to highlight the support needs of bereaved military children in the UK. Harry spoke frankly about the misconceptions children can have after losing a loved one.
summary: ​​Having lost his mother, Diana, Princess of Wales, at the age of 12, Prince Harry offered his perspective on coping with loss. The video, shot in May and released ahead of Armed Forces Day, aims to highlight the support needs of bereaved military children in the UK. Harry spoke frankly about the misconceptions children can have after losing a loved one.
